items.title: Trump Pushes Indiana Lawmakers to Redraw State Maps

items.title: Donald Trump claims ‘we’re getting along with China’ amid escalating trade war – US politics live
items.summary: <p>US president also says he is likely to meet China’s president Xi Jinping in South Korea</p><p><strong>The <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-senate">US Senate</a> failed on Thursday to re-open the government and to vote to fund the military during the federal government shutdown, ensuring that the standoff will stretch into next week.</strong></p><p>The Senate vote on a short-term <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/republicans">Republican</a> funding bill failed for the 10th time with just 51 votes. A second vote on Pentagon funding in the afternoon similarly failed in a floor vote, meaning the process to begin fully funding military operations also becomes a non-starter. After the votes, senators are expected to leave Washington for the weekend, almost guaranteeing the shutdown lasts until at least Monday.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/17/donald-trump-john-bolton-volodymyr-zelenskyy-us-politics-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: No Kings: what to know about the anti-Trump protests attracting millions
items.summary: <p>More than 2,500 US rallies are planned in all 50 states as protesters call for limits on presidential power</p><p>Millions are expected to show out for protests on Saturday at more than 2,500 locations across America, from small towns to large cities, to speak against the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a>.</p><p>No Kings, the coalition behind a mass demonstration in June, is again calling people to the streets to send the simple message that <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> is not a king, pushing back against what they see as increasing authoritarianism.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/17/no-kings-protests-millions-trump">Continue reading...</a>
